title: Genre: Law and Covenant Texts
objective: Interpret legal material within covenantal and social contexts

required_passages.text: Observe covenant obligations, imperative structure, and intended community transmission.

segments.audio_script: This is lesson nine. We study law texts and their covenant function.
Read Deuteronomy 6:4-9 and mark covenant commands, rationale, and expected practices.
Law appears in treaty-like structures. Note social, ritual, and restorative purposes. Laws regulate community life.
Distinguish casuistic from apodictic law. Consider intended audience and ritual frameworks when interpreting obligations.
Key idea: law functions to maintain covenant order and communal holiness.
Name a structural component of covenant law.
This completes lesson nine. Next lesson examines prophetic literature genre features.

vocabulary.definition: Direct, absolute commands often expressed as general principles

study_notes: Legal texts require attention to both wording and social practice; application requires careful analogical reasoning.
